welcome.title: Welcome to Abbacchio
welcome.subtitle: Real-time log viewer for any application
welcome.description: Stream logs from your Node.js, Python, or any HTTP-capable application with optional end-to-end encryption. Let's get you set up in just a few steps.

channel.title: Create a Channel
channel.description: A channel is a named stream where your application sends logs. You can create multiple channels for different apps or environments.
channel.channelHint: Use a descriptive name like your app name or environment
channel.keyHint: Save this key to encrypt your logs. You'll need it to view them later.

installation.title: Install the Transport
installation.description: Choose your platform and copy the code to start sending logs.
installation.httpDescription: No installation required. Send logs via HTTP POST from any language or tool.

password.title: Secure Your Data
password.description: Create a master password to protect your channel configurations.
password.masterPasswordHint: Your master password encrypts your channel settings locally. Make sure to remember it.

finish.title: You're All Set!
finish.description: Your channel "{{channel}}" is ready. Start your application and watch the logs stream in real-time.
